title: How do I get better??
body: I have been playing LoL for a little while now, and I'm getting up in the levels.  However, I'm just not good still and I keep going negative which causes my team to ignore my input for game progress.  I know what to do and how to play because my fiance has been playing for WAY longer than I have but I still can't get away from feeding fever.  I ping, I call mia's, I don't take unnecessary risks and I don't go into fights that I know I can't win BUT I still keep getting caught and unintentionally feeding which, in turn, pisses my team off and gets reported.  I thought that maybe it was a champ issue, so I bought my first champ and thought I could play a good Tristana--the same thing started happening after a few games.  I thought "Okay, maybe I'm just not a good ADC."  So I went mage and bought Lissandra, that didn't work out well AT ALL, just recently I bought Trynd and refunded him the next day.  I am trying to learn with Kat and MF because I like their styles and I feel like I do a little bit better with them but the same crap still happens.  Am I just having bad luck and being matched with terrible players and trolls, or do I just suck and should uninstall the game (the last bit is a joke, I just really want to get better)?  Please, I appreciate any and all advice and tips and tricks so that I can improve my game.  I want to be platinum someday, but I know at this rate I won't ever get there!  Also, if anyone wants to just play co-op or something with me and just coach me, I'd be happy with that! :)

replies.body: You're not even lvl 30 yet, don't worry, people shouldn't care too much about dying too much. It's a learning experience until you atleast hit 30 (even after you should have leeway), people who're pissed off are probably smurfs and have no rights to judge new players.
you obviously did not bother to look at the last 10 games.
Doesn't change the fact he isn't lvl 30

you stated dont worry about dying. 

If he is having a death issue and does not understand what is wrong, your not helping with that advice. Letting people who are asking for real help still develop bad habits is not a good thing.

and I'm telling him it's all a learning experience, everybody knows dying is a bad thing; it's obvious. I'm saying he shouldn't worry too much and experiment with the game. Alot of people go on here and ask for tips on how to play well and how not to feed and they aren't even lvl 30. They shouldn't be ashamed to die, wanting help is good, but they should understand that it's just a game. People who bitch at you for "dying" and "feeding" when it's the learning stage of the game, should be ignored.
death is only a learning experience if you can learn from it. if the OP was learning from it he would not be posting.
Hence why I gave him some general tips, but he shouldn't be ashamed of dying, or trying new champs/things out

Oh but in terms of getting better
-Focus on map awareness
-Practice last hitting
-Learn how champions work, knowing what champions do is 1/3 the battle, and it's impossible to remember 100+ champions, their skills, and passives. Watch champion spotlights or youtube videos of champions you had difficulties playing against (or even play them if you will)

Thats the general, after you hit lvl 30 and get better at those, come back with specific questions that we'll be more than glad to answer

Once you do hit level 30 don't even think about playing ranked. Trust me. Stay away from ranked. Even if a friend wants to duo with you. Buy most of the champions first. Get good in all the lanes. FINISH YOUR RUNE PAGES. If you do that and just keep playing and trying to do better in the laning phase to beat your opponent you should be good. Basically in laning phase you just want to practice last hitting. The more cs you have the more gold you get. The more gold you get the more items. Don't go for kills in laning phase. Keep poking your enemy down and last hitting minions at the same time. Only go for a kill if your jungler is there, the enemy turret dives you, or the enemy is low enough where you KNOW you will secure the kill. One last thing. Watch streamers. They will give out helpful  advice most of the time. That's all.

Yeah, I don't plan on even attempting to get placed until I own a few different champs per role and feel very confident about playing other roles --and I know that's going to be quite some time.  Reading your bit about when to attempt kills has me rethinking my previous statement about not making bad calls.  Sure I ping and MIA, but looking back I DO make crap decisions and that's what gets me killed.  Are there any streamers that you would recommend?  I prefer ADC or support, but since I want to learn other roles as well then any streamers should do.

For ADC i don't have anyone. Same for support. Just go around twitch and find support and adc mains. Hell even watch a youtube video about it.

Thank you guys for all of your replies and advice.  I admit that I was a little egotistical when I posted this.  I'm not that smart of a player and I don't know EVERYTHING about the game like I feel that I made myself out to do.  I guess I just got so sick of being terrible that I decided to just pin it on strangers that I've played with.  I think I've narrowed down what I do need to work on, however.

I need to:
-Acquire better map awareness, since 9/10 times I get caught is because I focus where I am and not the minimal,
-Learn how to better estimate odds and decide WHEN exactly I can get a kill and how,
-NOT OVEREXTEND, and
-Know how and when to play offensively/aggressive or just stay the F back.

If it interests you I am looking for newer players to coach and help improve simply add me in game and I will answer any questions you have and play with you and tell you what I see you are doing incorrectly.

Yeah, that really interests me!  I think one thing that would really help me is just having a coach.  I have tried guides and watching videos and even looking up quick counter tips in-game and nothing helps. But yeah, I've just gotten so tired of constantly going negative in games and being flamed for feeding.  I feel like it should be a learning experience, however, I seem to not be learning anything but how to die differently, lol.

Learn what most popular champions you see very often do.
Find champion you enjoy.

Start from actually playing against your girl 1v1. Make her use different champions but you play only one. Its fastest and best way of understanding how certain lanes works and how you should play in future. It will hurt and you will feel pretty bad about her whooping your ass but every time you get closer to beating her, you will feel better. Plus she might choose champs that are really bad against yours and you will understand how counterpick works (meaning sometimes you just can't fight or you will die regardless how good you are).

Record and watch some replays of your games. Watch streams and read lol Wiki if you don't understand what happend and why you died so fast. 

There are TONS of guides that will help you train faster and more effective. They are all free and easy to find. Just ask your fiance about them, she will tell you if its good or not. Every player in LoL used guide at some point. Being it champion guide, zoning guide, lane guide, jungle guide or to learn your dog play ryze while you go to toilet guide.
I suggest that you try ether mid laning or top with maybe temo or a ranged champion

dont build 2 guardin angels? You supposedly know what your doing yet your last game has 2 of them built. 

Do not play ARAMs. They do not teach you how to be better at the game.

Why are you picking katerina when according to your self you have a death problem. Kat is useless if the enemy team has moderate CC. Your picking a snow ball champ and failing and you wonder why people do not listen to you? Your making bad game choices right from the start and then not backing them up. No one in there right mind will listen to you in game. 

When playing mid grab someone with some ulity so if you fall behind you are still of value to the team. 

When playing ADC pick someone with some kind of mobility(MF does not have mobility). Learn corki, cait, ez, lucian, trist(though getting kit reworked in 5.2). They have jumps and can get over walls and try to escape when people get on top of you.

Wards are extremely powerful, if early on in the game you end up having 100 extra gold picking up a pink ward and placing it somewhere it will give good vision but the other team wont find it is strong. The LCS is starting up next weekend I recommend watching and paying attention during team fights and I mean pay attention. If you want to learn more about a specific champion or role then just watch that person during one of the fights. Playing safer will win your more games because during solo queue matches there is almost always one team that throws the match by going over aggressive or just makes a small mistake to cost a team fight or dragon. If you are playing katarina I enjoy building a Twin Shadows first item because it gives her some CC and is also helpful when escaping, plus the move speed is just generally good for melee champs right now. Learning last hitting of minions is also extremely important as otherwise you will not earn gold from minions. If you are ahead in your lane and you find time where you are alone in lane and the enemies are dead/shopping and returning to lane try to make a roam to one of the nearby lanes, even if you dont do anything but show your face it will change the way your opponents will be playing.  Watch the map if you are going aggressive on someone but see that someone is missing in another lane just be prepared to make a retreat at any time or just back off right away if you dont want to risk giving a kill and getting nothing out of it. 

I am not a great player by any standards but I have been playing since season 1 and I am almost always watching league streams as long as I am at my computer because I have dual monitors. http://www.twitch.tv/sickmotionlol this is a very good streamer but he mainly plays top lane. He often talks about mistakes he makes and mistakes people he is playing with makes. But mostly just ward and play safe until you learn the limits of the champions you are playing as/against. If you havent already just learn what every champion does as far as their abilities goes because if you are playing against someone and they do something and you go "whut was that?" you are at a disadvantage. Also dont worry about refunding champions you bought with IP... only refund skins you bought with rp because you only get 3 refunds for the rest of time. Dont buy champs with rp even if you really want to play them... it just is not worth the money but then again I dont have money to spend so yeah... You can add me if you want and I can play some games with you. You are always going to be running into trolls, feeders and leavers in this game the best thing you can do is just stay calm and focus on your own playing because that is how you get better.



edit: I should probably say the streamer I linked streams pretty late at night so you might not be up when he streams. Here is his youtube page which I have not looked at so I dont know if it is as informative as his stream but im sure it will help at least a little. https://www.youtube.com/user/SickMotionLoL/featured You can add me on "No Plz Dont Rage" as it is closer to your level and wont mess with matchmaking too badly
you can add me if you want, and I can watch one of your games and let you know what you need to work on or we can play together.
